article.headline: Hartford 79, Dartmouth 59
article.story: WEST HARTFORD, Conn. (AP) -- Charles Ford scored 17 points and Demarcquez Rembert added 14 points to lead the University of Hartford to a 79-59 victory over Dartmouth Thursday night. Hartford (1-2) used exceptional 3-point shooting to build a 45-19 halftime advantage. The Hawks were 8-for-10 from 3-point range in the half, including a 2-for-2 performance from Ford. Rembert made two of his three 3-point attempts in the opening half. The Hawks were 17-for-28 from the field in the first half with Ford leading the way with 11 points. A 3-pointer by Rembert with 14:23 left in the second half gave the Hawks their biggest lead, 57-28. Dartmouth (1-3) then went on an 18-0 run, capped by a basket by Chuck Flynn that cut the deficit to 57-46 with 9:08 left in the game. Ford ended what was nearly a six-minute drought for the Hawks when he made a steal and a layup to put Hartford up 59-46 with 8:08 remaining. Dartmouth was never able to get closer than 13 points the rest of the contest. Hartford finished with a 47-23 rebounding advantage. The Hawks finished the game making 11-of-16 3-point attempts. Flynn, who didn't play in the first half, led the Big Green with 13 points.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
